main.desc: Mount Everest, the worldâ€™s highest peak, stands at an impressive elevation of 8,848.86 meters (29,031.7 feet) above sea level. This majestic mountain has long captured the imagination of climbers and adventurers, drawing them to its challenging slopes and breathtaking vistas. From its icy glaciers to the thin air at its summit, Everest remains an enduring symbol of human determination and the indomitable spirit of exploration.
